name: Rising Dragon Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is quite a good 2/ /3 star hotel, although i have stayed in better.
reviews.title: Quite good - some problems with rooms

reviews.text: I was put on the 6th floor which was OK - good exercise but wouldn't be good for people who are very unfit. The room itself is ok. VERY hard bed which I quite like but others might not. The thing that puzzled me was that there were some things in the room that could be changed for very little money, but it seems the owners don't quite care enough. For example a moldy shower curtain. A bedside lap which doesn't work and is plugged in behind the bed which is difficult to get to, a shower head which is very old and sprays water all over the bathroom. If you look at the picture I put up, you will see that the bath has a large black "counter" around it and when you put the shower on and water sprays all over it and the water pools there and eventually soaks the floor. A good shower head would solve this problem. These are little things but when you are in the room it leaves a bad impression.
reviews.title: A great location .

reviews.text: The roof also started to leak as we had quite heavy rain one night, but the staff were very good at moving to the same room one floor down (which was a nicer room anyway). You might not want to stay on the top floor in the wet season.
reviews.title: A perfect home away from home

reviews.text: The breakfast is adequite. The staff are very nice and helpful. Good to have computer access. The hotel is in a very good location. One other annoying thing was that often there weren't enough safes for guest to lock away their valuables.
reviews.title: OK, Return visitors, better than 1st time

reviews.text: Overall, I wouldn't stay here again as I believe there would be places of a similar price but make a bit more of an effort with the rooms.
reviews.title: A winner in Hanoi

reviews.text: I have recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be a completely perfect experience.
reviews.title: Best in Hanoi

likes.disliked: — No lifts and a big step into and out of the shower/bath

reviews.text: The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. It was amazing value for money and the service was extremely friendly and personable. Even when we stayed out past closing times (the whole of Vietnam seems to pull down its shutters) they had no problems letting us in. Perfect airport transfer, and rang us taxi's whenever we required.
reviews.title: Amazing value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have asked for more in terms of the location. Close (right next door if your after silk purses!) to great shops, beautiful restaurants (E.g. Five) and the BEST pub in Vietnam Le Pub.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was yum, and great value added into the price. Free internet and some very lovely artworks in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great people

likes.liked: — the proffessional and friendly staff and the excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the staff of the hotel made this the best stay that we had on our trip.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff, but one bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Hanoi during a cold spell. After a day of touring, we came to our room to find the heater broken. The hotel was not able to fix the heater, give us another room, or even promise to provide a heater for the next night. There were several other problems like the bedside lamp not working, the bathroom door broken and unable to be shut, the drawers too dirty to put clothes in. We changed hotels the next day.
reviews.title: Too many things broken

reviews.text: I never write these things but we completely loved staying here. We arrived in Hanoi after midnight - but the hotel sent a driver to greet us at no extra charge due to our 4 night stay (And they returned us at some ungodly hour in the morning). We arrived on a dark and empty street and I was worried we picked a bad location till I woke up the next morning and the streets of the historic district were buzzing. Get up really early and see the women on the street selling vegetables on yoked baskets to the Vietnamese "before" the other market down the block even opens. You are blocks from the Lake, the water pupperts, several outdoor markets - The Green Tangerine - an expensive (by Vietnamese standards) gourmet restaurant is across the street. The rooms were spotlessly clean - go for room 201 and the rooms above for French influenced architecture - tall ceilings - a terrace above the street - nice furnishings. But bring earplugs if you plan to sleep in because Hanoi rises early and those motorbikes have to honk at something.)Because we loved it here and wanted to stay longer we were switched to a room with a window onto a lightwell - which we liked less - but it was much less expensive than the $45 USD we spent for our room with Terrace. There is a breakfast included consisting of good vietnamese coffee, fruit, and traditional beef Pho or an omelet with french bread - both got us out the door each day. The real; reason to stay here is the people that work here - they were EXTRAORDINARY to us -kind, helpful, polite and a delight to deal with. Ask them to help you set up your next accomodations as you move on your trip - and book trips to Halong Bay with Tri at her desk in the lobby. My only reluctance to writing this is that YOU might be in room 201 the next time I might want to stay there. Hope you like it too.
reviews.title: Authentic Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a very good location, right in the center of the Old Quarter. The room was clean for a 3star hotel, and bed was comfortable, I like super firm bed. All staffs were very friendly. It's okay for a $30 per night in Hanoi.
reviews.title: Good enough

likes.disliked: — Horrible Coffee at the breakfast area

reviews.title: Great location - most friendly staff
reviews.text: Breakfast was not worth a try and coffee was horrible. Hotel should have provide some hot water during the night to drink. It was empty for the 4 nights that I stay there.
Hanoi is safe to walk around to do your own tour.
reviews.title: Great location, helful staffs

reviews.text: Our family of five stayed at the Rising Dragon for two nights in April at the end of our 3 week Vietnam holiday. It certainly has a wonderful central location, (very short walk to the Water Puppet Theatre, Hoan Kiem Lake, and is slap bang in the middle of the street market area) The booking counter down on the ground floor did an excellent job with our Halong Bay tour, and we cant complain about the taxi service they organized for us to the airport (at 5.30am) 40 kms to the airport - cost was US$15.
reviews.title: Great central location!
Don't believe the hype!
reviews.text: There are also some great restaurants very close by - which are recommended on pamphlets in the rooms - we ate at an excellent Indian Restaurant just a few doors up, and also a Vegetarian one (that had plenty of chicken, pork and prawns on the menu!!!)

reviews.title: Unbeatable service and warmth!
reviews.text: This was one of the more costly hotels that we stayed in - probably for a little less value (but that could just be typical of Hanoi?)

The bathtub for me was an issue getting into as, in both rooms we booked ( the kids had a separate room) they had very high sided bath tubs - not easy if you are arthritic. You had to remember to turn on the water heater ten minutes before if you wanted a hot shower (not really a huge issue)There is also no lift, so lugging heavy backpacks up 4 flights of stairs is no fun. I felt the place just needed a jolly good spring clean (especially the stairwell area) and there are strange cage/wire enclosures in the stairwells making me feel like the place would be a bit of a firetrap.Our room was not so well cleaned, as there were lots of empties thrown in the wardrobe from the party that the previous tenants had enjoyed the night before.The breakfast was quite adequate (omlette cooked as soon as you sat down - if you knew to order one) but not as much of a choice as other hotels that we stayed in around the rest of the country. (No one came to replenish anything as it ran out - we had to ask for juice etc. as the cartons were empty. They were very obliging when it came to storing our packs when we went to Halong Bay overnight.
reviews.title: Very basic. Not sure why so many good reviews.

likes.disliked: — The room is just too basic & the a/c didn't work

reviews.text: I sound like a trivial whinger - but for $25 less per night we got much better service and surroundings in some other hotels in Vietnam.
reviews.title: Loved the Rising Dragon

description: Description of Rooms/Suites: Our hotel boasts large smoking and non-smoking rooms, some of which have beautiful balconies overlooking the Old Quarter and large bathrooms with bathtubs. Each deluxe and standard room in our safe and quiet building has air conditioning and hot water.Amenities: The on-site restaurant has a wide menu for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Guests are provided with a free continental breakfast as part of their stay. Wireless internet is available, as are computers in our hotel lounge.
